heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 16.6mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 2nd from our records) and resulted in 5.69mm of total rain in 3.2 hours.  The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 4th since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 10 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is not an active heatwave.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current wind direction is south-westerly (204°), which is about average.  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.0°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 9%) and rainfall (down 1.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.9°C), inside temperature (up 1.8°C), and cloud levels (up 712 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 788.8m higher than yesterday, 348.8m higher than the past week, 711.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 565m minimum and 1838m maximum, with an average of 1899.3m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1550.5m and 2610m.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and near calm conditions. Rain showers likely, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and sunlight will be very intense and bright. Changeable conditions.
